title: How to Have Twins on The Sims 2

steps.title: Raise a Sim's Cooking skill.
steps.content: Raise a Sim's Cooking skill. In order to bake a cheesecake, a Sim needs to have at least seven Cooking skill points. You can raise their skill level by having them study Cooking from a bookshelf, watching The Yummy Channel on TV, preparing meals, and using the chocolate-maker Career Reward from the Culinary career track.

steps.title: Get a Sim pregnant.
steps.content: Get a Sim pregnant. In most cases, Sims will get pregnant through Try For Baby; after the Sims have finished the action, a lullaby chime will play if the Sim is now pregnant. In more rare cases, adult male Sims who were abducted by aliens will return pregnant.

steps.title: Have the Sim with high Cooking skill bake a cheesecake.
steps.content: Have the Sim with high Cooking skill bake a cheesecake.

steps.title: Direct the pregnant Sim to eat cheesecake.
steps.content: Direct the pregnant Sim to eat cheesecake. A pregnant Sim who has eaten cheesecake will give birth to twins. Your Sim only needs to eat cheesecake once to have twins.

steps.title: Get a Sim pregnant.
steps.content: Get a Sim pregnant. Sims most commonly get pregnant through Try For Baby, though in rare cases, adult male Sims will return from alien abduction pregnant.

steps.title: Select the pregnant Sim.
steps.content: Select the pregnant Sim. The cheat won't work if another Sim is active.

steps.title: Open the cheat console.
steps.content: Open the cheat console. Hit Ctrl + ⇧ Shift + C .

steps.title: Type in forcetwins and hit ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type in forcetwins and hit ↵ Enter . This will guarantee your Sim will have twins.

steps.title: Make sure the Sim's primary aspiration is Family.
steps.content: Make sure the Sim's primary aspiration is Family. This will not work if the Sim's secondary aspiration is Family - it must be their primary aspiration.

steps.title: Go to your Sim's inventory and rewards panel.
steps.content: Go to your Sim's inventory and rewards panel. Click on the treasure chest icon in the last section of the Sim's UI.

steps.title: Open the Lifetime Rewards tab.
steps.content: Open the Lifetime Rewards tab. (This is the third tab, and should look like a Family icon and a treasure chest combined.) Then, click on the icon to the left that looks like a child, adult, and treasure chest. This icon is for Lifetime Aspiration Benefits.

steps.title: Find the Family column.
steps.content: Find the Family column. Click each box until you reach "Super Fertility" at the top of the panel. This costs 4 Aspiration Points.

steps.title: Have your Sim have a baby.
steps.content: Have your Sim have a baby. Super Fertility naturally raises your Sim's chance of conceiving twins, so after you have the reward, you don't need to do anything besides make the Sim have a baby!
